intro: Cracca nubica, commonly known as the alpine cracca, is a flowering plant native to the high mountain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Cracca nubica is known for its resilience to harsh climates and is a symbol of mountainous ecosystems.
